sap.uxap.AnchorBar.description: Anchor bar is the navigation bar of an Object page. Its purpose is to provide links to all Sections and Subsections. Takes the form of a Select on phone.
sap.uxap.AnchorBar.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new AnchorBar. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowPopover showPopover} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUpperCase upperCase} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.Toolbar#constructor sap.m.Toolbar} can be used as well.
sap.uxap.AnchorBar.helpDescription: Anchor bar is the navigation bar of an Object page. Its purpose is to provide links to all Sections and Subsections. Takes the form of a Select on phone.

An ObjectPageSection is the top-level information container of an Object page. Its purpose is to aggregate Subsections.
Disclaimer: This control is intended to be used only as part of the Object page layout
sap.uxap.ObjectPageSection.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ObjectPageSection. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowTitle showTitle} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getTitleUppercase titleUppercase} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSubSections subSections} : sap.uxap.ObjectPageSubSection[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.uxap.ObjectPageSectionBase#constructor sap.uxap.ObjectPageSectionBase} can be used as well.

customAnchorBarButton.description:
The custom button that will provide a link to the section in the ObjectPageLayout anchor bar.
This button will be used as a custom template to be into the ObjectPageLayout anchorBar area, therefore property changes happening on this button template after the first rendering won't affect the actual button copy used in the anchorBar.

If you want to change some of the button properties, you would need to bind them to a model.

sap.uxap.BreadCrumbs.description:
The BreadCrumbs control represents the navigation steps up to the current location in the application and allows
the user to quickly navigate to a previous location on the path that got him to the current location.
It has two main modes of operation. One is a trail of links followed by separators (when there's enough space
for the control to fit on one line), and the other is a dropdown list with the links (when the trail of links
wouldn't fit on one line).
sap.uxap.BreadCrumbs.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new BreadCrumbs. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowCurrentLocation showCurrentLocation} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getLinks links} : sap.m.Link[] (default)
    • {@link #getCurrentLocation currentLocation} : sap.m.Text
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.uxap.BreadCrumbs.helpDescription:
The BreadCrumbs control represents the navigation steps up to the current location in the application and allows
the user to quickly navigate to a previous location on the path that got him to the current location.
It has two main modes of operation. One is a trail of links followed by separators (when there's enough space
for the control to fit on one line), and the other is a dropdown list with the links (when the trail of links
wouldn't fit on one line).

sap.uxap.ObjectPageSectionBase.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ObjectPageSectionBase. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getImportance importance} : sap.uxap.Importance (default: library.Importance.High)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getCustomAnchorBarButton customAnchorBarButton} : sap.m.Button
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

customAnchorBarButton.description:
The custom button that will provide a link to the section in the ObjectPageLayout anchor bar.
This button will be used as a custom template to be into the ObjectPageLayout anchorBar area, therefore property changes happening on this button template after the first rendering won't affect the actual button copy used in the anchorBar.

If you want to change some of the button properties, you would need to bind them to a model.

sap.uxap.BlockBase.description: A block is the main element that will be displayed, mainly in an object page, but not necessarily only there. A block is a control that use a XML view for storing its internal control tree. A block is a control that has modes and a view associated to each modes. At rendering time, the view associated to the mode is rendered. Note: The control supports only XML views. As any UI5 views, the XML view can have a controller which automatically comes a this.oParentBlock attribute (so that the controller can interacts with the block). If the controller implements the onParentBlockModeChange method, this method will get called with the sMode parameter when the view is used or re-used by the block.
sap.uxap.BlockBase.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new BlockBase. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getMode mode} : string
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getColumnLayout columnLayout} : sap.uxap.BlockBaseColumnLayout (default: auto)
    • {@link #getFormAdjustment formAdjustment} : sap.uxap.BlockBaseFormAdjustment (default: BlockColumns)
    • {@link #getShowSubSectionMore showSubSectionMore} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getMappings mappings} : sap.uxap.ModelMapping[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.uxap.BlockBase.helpDescription: A block is the main element that will be displayed, mainly in an object page, but not necessarily only there. A block is a control that use a XML view for storing its internal control tree. A block is a control that has modes and a view associated to each modes. At rendering time, the view associated to the mode is rendered. Note: The control supports only XML views. As any UI5 views, the XML view can have a controller which automatically comes a this.oParentBlock attribute (so that the controller can interacts with the block). If the controller implements the onParentBlockModeChange method, this method will get called with the sMode parameter when the view is used or re-used by the block.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached, keyed by the model names. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.setModel(models[k], k). For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single model instance can be given which will be set as default model.

formAdjustment.description:
Determines if the block should automatically adjust its inner forms.
Allowed values are "BlockColumns" and "OneColumn" and "None".
If the value is "BlockColumns", then the inner form will have as many columns as the colspan of its parent block.
If the value is "OneColumn", the inner form will have exactly one column, regardless the colspan of its parent block.
If the value is "None", no automatic adjustment of inner forms will be made and the form will keep its original column count.

sap.uxap.ObjectPageHeaderContent.description:
ObjectPageHeaderContent represents the dynamic part of an Object page header. May contain any control.
Unlike the Object page header title, the Object page header content is part of the scrolling area of the Object page.
This enables it to hold any amount of information and still be usable on a mobile device.
sap.uxap.ObjectPageHeaderContent.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ObjectPageHeaderContent. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getContentDesign contentDesign} : sap.uxap.ObjectPageHeaderDesign (default: Light)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

sap.uxap.ObjectPageLayout.description: An ObjectPageLayout is the layout control, used to put together all parts of an Object page - Header, Navigation bar and Sections/Subsections.
sap.uxap.ObjectPageLayout.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ObjectPageLayout. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowAnchorBar showAnchorBar} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowAnchorBarPopover showAnchorBarPopover} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUpperCaseAnchorBar upperCaseAnchorBar} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getEnableLazyLoading enableLazyLoading} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSubSectionLayout subSectionLayout} : sap.uxap.ObjectPageSubSectionLayout (default: TitleOnTop)
    • {@link #getUseIconTabBar useIconTabBar} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowHeaderContent showHeaderContent} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUseTwoColumnsForLargeScreen useTwoColumnsForLargeScreen} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowTitleInHeaderContent showTitleInHeaderContent} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowOnlyHighImportance showOnlyHighImportance} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIsChildPage isChildPage} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAlwaysShowContentHeader alwaysShowContentHeader} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowEditHeaderButton showEditHeaderButton} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFlexEnabled flexEnabled} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSections sections} : sap.uxap.ObjectPageSection[] (default)
    • {@link #getHeaderTitle headerTitle} : sap.uxap.ObjectPageHeader
    • {@link #getHeaderContent headerContent} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:toggleAnchorBar toggleAnchorBar} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:editHeaderButtonPress editHeaderButtonPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:tabSelect tabSelect} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.uxap.ObjectPageLayout.helpDescription: An ObjectPageLayout is the layout control, used to put together all parts of an Object page - Header, Navigation bar and Sections/Subsections.

sap.uxap.ObjectPageLazyLoader.description:
ObjectPageLazyLoader is a helper element that enables a "stashed"-based lazy loading approach for the content of
the sap.uxap.ObjectPageSubSection control. ObjectPageLazyLoader is intended to be used in a declarative way only
(e.g. in a view) with the "stashed" property set to "true", and is recommended to be used only once per
subsection as its sole content.

ObjectPageLazyLoader utilizes UI5's stashing mechanism and is a lightweight alternative to the native block-based
Lazy Loading of the Object Page. Wrapping the content of a subsection in an ObjectPageLazyLoader with "stashed=true"
will make the said content unstash automatically as the user scrolls.

Note: Subsections are required to have an ID when used with ObjectPageLazyLoader.
sap.uxap.ObjectPageLazyLoader.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ObjectPageLazyLoader. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.uxap.ObjectPageLazyLoader.helpDescription:
ObjectPageLazyLoader is a helper element that enables a "stashed"-based lazy loading approach for the content of
the sap.uxap.ObjectPageSubSection control. ObjectPageLazyLoader is intended to be used in a declarative way only
(e.g. in a view) with the "stashed" property set to "true", and is recommended to be used only once per
subsection as its sole content.

ObjectPageLazyLoader utilizes UI5's stashing mechanism and is a lightweight alternative to the native block-based
Lazy Loading of the Object Page. Wrapping the content of a subsection in an ObjectPageLazyLoader with "stashed=true"
will make the said content unstash automatically as the user scrolls.

Note: Subsections are required to have an ID when used with ObjectPageLazyLoader.

sap.uxap.ObjectPageSubSection.description:
An ObjectPageSubSection is the second-level information container of an Object page and may only be used within an Object page section.
Subsections may display primary information in the so called blocks aggregation (always visible)
and not-so-important information in the moreBlocks aggregation, whose content is initially hidden, but may be accessed via a See more (...) button.
Disclaimer: This control is intended to be used only as part of the Object page layout
sap.uxap.ObjectPageSubSection.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ObjectPageSubSection. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getMode mode} : sap.uxap.ObjectPageSubSectionMode (default: Collapsed)
    • {@link #getTitleUppercase titleUppercase} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getBlocks blocks} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
    • {@link #getMoreBlocks moreBlocks} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getActions actions} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.uxap.ObjectPageSectionBase#constructor sap.uxap.ObjectPageSectionBase} can be used as well.

sap.uxap.ObjectPageHeader.description:
ObjectPageHeader represents the static part of an Object page header.
Typically used to display the basic information about a business object, such as title/description/picture, as well as a list of common actions.
sap.uxap.ObjectPageHeader.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ObjectPageHeader. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getObjectImageURI objectImageURI} : string
    • {@link #getObjectImageAlt objectImageAlt} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getObjectImageDensityAware objectImageDensityAware} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getObjectTitle objectTitle} : string
    • {@link #getObjectSubtitle objectSubtitle} : string
    • {@link #getObjectImageShape objectImageShape} : sap.uxap.ObjectPageHeaderPictureShape (default: Square)
    • {@link #getIsObjectIconAlwaysVisible isObjectIconAlwaysVisible} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIsObjectTitleAlwaysVisible isObjectTitleAlwaysVisible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getIsObjectSubtitleAlwaysVisible isObjectSubtitleAlwaysVisible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getIsActionAreaAlwaysVisible isActionAreaAlwaysVisible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHeaderDesign headerDesign} : sap.uxap.ObjectPageHeaderDesign (default: Light)
    • {@link #getShowTitleSelector showTitleSelector} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getMarkFavorite markFavorite} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getMarkFlagged markFlagged} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowMarkers showMarkers} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getMarkLocked markLocked} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowPlaceholder showPlaceholder} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getMarkChanges markChanges} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getBreadCrumbsLinks breadCrumbsLinks} : sap.m.Link[]
    • {@link #getNavigationBar navigationBar} : sap.m.Bar
    • {@link #getActions actions} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
    • {@link #getSideContentButton sideContentButton} : sap.m.Button
  • Events
    • {@link #event:titleSelectorPress titleSelectorPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:markLockedPress markLockedPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:markChangesPress markChangesPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

sap.uxap.HierarchicalSelect.description:
A select that display items on 2 level of hierarchy.
If a provided item has a custom data named "secondLevel", then it will be displayed as a second level, otherwise it would be displayed as a first level.
sap.uxap.HierarchicalSelect.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new HierarchicalSelect. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getUpperCase upperCase} : boolean (default: false)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.Select#constructor sap.m.Select} can be used as well.
sap.uxap.HierarchicalSelect.helpDescription:
A select that display items on 2 level of hierarchy.
If a provided item has a custom data named "secondLevel", then it will be displayed as a second level, otherwise it would be displayed as a first level.

width.description: Sets the width of the control. The default width is derived from the widest item. If the width defined is smaller than the widest item in the selection list, only the width of the selection field will be changed: the list will keep the width of its widest item. If the list is wider than the viewport, it is truncated and an ellipsis is displayed for each item. For phones, the width of the list is always the same as the viewport. Note: This property is ignored if the autoAdjustWidth property is set to true.
